section.title: Desired user interface
section.para: In the following exercises you create the basis of the application user interface. At the end of this exercise your user interface should look similar to the following screenshot.

section.title: Open the Application.e4xmi file
section.para:
Open the Application.e4xmi file in the Eclipse 4 model editor via a double-click or right-click on it and select
Open With Eclipse 4 model editor
.

section.title: Add a perspective
section.para: Add a perspective stack with one perspective to your application model so that you can later easily add more of them.
Navigate to your window inside the Application.e4xmi file. Select the Controls node. Add a Perspective Stack via the context menu on the Controls entry as indicated in the following screenshot.

textobject.phrase: Adding a PerspectiveStack to the Eclipse RCP application

tip.para: Alternatively to the context menu you can also use the Add... button on the detail page to add child elements to the selected element.

section.para: After creating the perspective stack add a Perspective to it, either via the context menu or the Add... button.
Enter the To-do value in the Label field and the com.example.e4.rcp.todo.perspective value in the ID field.

textobject.phrase: Adding a Perspective to the Eclipse 4 application

section.title: Add part sash and part stack containers
section.para: Select Controls below the newly created perspective and add a part sash container element.
Change its Orientation attribute to Horizontal and enter into the ID field the com.example.e4.rcp.todo.partsashcontainer.main value.
Add a part stack as the first child to your part sash container element.
Re-select the parent part sash container and add another part sash container element. Now add two part stacks to the second part sash container.
After these changes your application model should look similar to the following screenshot.

section.title: Create the parts
section.para: Add a part model element to each part stack. As ID for the parts use the prefix com.example.e4.rcp.todo.part and the suffix from the following table. Also put the label from the table into the appropriate field of the part editor.

table.title: Label and ID from the Parts

section.para: The final structure of your application model should be similar to the following screenshot. The screenshot also shows the detailed data of the overview part inside the detail pane of the application model editor.

section.title: Validate the user interface
section.para: Start your product and validate that the user interface looks as planned. Reassign your model elements if required. The model editor supports drag-and drop for reassignment.
Also note that you can already see the structure, even though you have not created any Java classes so far.
